intro: Ficus dimorpha, commonly known as the two-leaf fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its distinctive leaves, which have two different forms on either side of the stem—one smooth and the other rough. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Ficus dimorpha is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
